messages.content:
You are a research assistant with access to a memory system. Your task is to answer the user's question by searching and retrieving information from memory.

Instructions:
- Use memory_search to find relevant information for the question.
- Use memory_retrieve to get full document details when you need specifics.
- Use memory_capabilities to understand what the memory system offers, including available search modes, filter fields, and any extra tools.
- If extra tools are available (e.g. batch_retrieve), prefer them for efficiency — they can fetch multiple documents in one call instead of one call per document.
- Synthesize your findings into a clear, concise answer.
- IMPORTANT: For each claim in your answer, cite the supporting episode using the format [ref_id]. Every factual statement must have at least one citation.
- If you cannot find sufficient information, say so clearly.
- You have a limited number of turns and tool calls. Use them efficiently.
How quickly is the checkout error rate escalating?

messages.reasoning: We need to answer: "How quickly is the checkout error rate escalating?" Likely refers to some metric in a dataset about checkout error rate over time. Need to search memory.
We need to answer: "How quickly is the checkout error rate escalating?" Need to find relevant info in memory about checkout error rate and its escalation speed. Use memory_search with query.

messages.reasoning: We have multiple daily summaries with checkout error rates. Need to answer: "How quickly is the checkout error rate escalating?" So we need to compute rate of increase over time. Use data points: Jan 28 err 0.82%, Jan 29 0.71% (actually decreased), Jan 30 1.56%, Jan 31 1.82%, Feb 2 2.3%. Also Jan 30 1.56% after Jan 29 0.71% jump. So escalation from early Jan 28 to Feb 2. Compute daily change: Jan 28 0.82% to Jan 30 1.56% increase 0.74% over 2 days ~0.37% per day. Then Jan 30 to Jan 31 increase 0.26% (0.26% per day). Jan 31 to Feb 2 increase 0.48% over 2 days ~0.24% per day. Overall from Jan 28 to Feb 2 increase 1.48% over 5 days ~0.30% per day. Provide answer with citations. Need to retrieve maybe one doc for each date to cite. Already have search results with text. We can retrieve each ref to get full doc for citation. Use batch? No extra tools. We'll retrieve each needed ref.

{"ref_id": "cascading_failure_01_ep_014", "text": "## 2024-01-28 Daily Operations Summary

### Endpoint Performance
- /checkout: REQUESTS 136900 | p50: 140ms p95: 360ms p99: 650ms | err: 0.82% (1120 errors) | success: 99.18%
- /fraud_check: REQUESTS 136500 | p50: 92ms p95: 255ms p99: 420ms | err: 0.19% (260 errors) | success: 99.81%
- /geo_lookup: REQUESTS 134100 | p50: 130ms p95: 310ms p99: 400ms | err: 0.12% (160 errors) | success: 99.88%
- /auth: REQUESTS 178200 | p50: 34ms p95: 90ms p99: 150ms | err: 0.06% (110 errors) | success: 99.94%
- /product_catalog: REQUESTS 238800 | p50: 42ms p95: 118ms p99: 200ms | err: 0.07% (160 errors) | success: 99.93%
- /search: REQUESTS 206500 | p50: 62ms p95: 160ms p99: 270ms | err: 0.12% (240 errors) | success: 99.88%
- /recommendations: REQUESTS 167800 | p50: 72ms p95: 200ms p99: 340ms | err: 0.14% (240 errors) | success: 99.86%

### Infrastructure
- gateway-01: CPU 55% | Mem 69% | Disk 62% | Conns: 3050 | Net: 540/640 Mbps
- gateway-02: CPU 52% | Mem 67% | Disk 61% | Conns: 2920 | Net: 525/622 Mbps
- service-b-01: CPU 50% | Mem 65% | Disk 58% | Conns: 2150 | Net: 360/410 Mbps
- metrics-db-01: CPU 33% | Mem 72% | Disk 83% | Conns: 290 | Net: 128/155 Mbps

### Connection Pools
- primary: active 150 | idle 50 | waiting 18 | exhaustion: 1 | max: 200 | avg_wait: 18ms
- replica: active 65 | idle 35 | waiting 1 | exhaustion: 0 | max: 100 | avg_wait: 2ms
- third_party_geo: active 56 | idle 4 | waiting 15 | exhaustion: 2 | max: 60 | avg_wait: 45ms

### CDN & Caching
- Hit rate: 93.2% | Bandwidth: 7.6 Gbps | Origin requests: 382900

### Alerts
- [CRITICAL] CHECKOUT-ERROR-RATE on gateway-01: error_pct=0.82
- [WARNING] CONNPOOL-WAIT on gateway-01: pool=primary waiting=18 avg_wait_ms=18
- [WARNING] UPSTREAM-LATENCY on gateway-02: geo_lookup_p99_ms=400

### Deployments & Changes
- Deployed service-C (checkout) v3.2.1

### Events
- Service-C deploy completed with schema migration (backward compatible)
- A/B test 'checkout-v2' at 15% rollout
- metrics-db vacuum executed 2024-01-28 01:00Z
- Scaled checkout-worker pool from 8 to 10 instances

### On-Call
- Shift: L. Nguyen. 5 pages (CHECKOUT-ERROR-RATE, CONNPOOL-WAIT). 2 tickets (CO-778 rollback plan, DB-902 pool wait). function.name: memory_search
function.description: Search the memory system for relevant information. Available search modes: semantic.

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return. Default: 10.

function.name: memory_retrieve
function.description: Retrieve a full document by its reference ID.

ref_id.description: The reference ID of the document to retrieve.

function.name: memory_capabilities
function.description: Get the capability manifest describing what the memory system offers.

message.reasoning: We need to answer: "How quickly is the checkout error rate escalating?" Need to compute rate of increase over days. We have data for several dates: 2024-01-28 err 0.82%; 2024-01-29 err 0.71% (actually decreased). Wait 0.71% lower than 0.82% (decrease). But later dates show increase: 2024-01-30 err 1.56%; 2024-01-31 err 1.82%; 2024-02-02 err 2.3%. So escalation from 0.71% on Jan 29 to 2.3% on Feb 2. Need to compute daily increase maybe percent points per day. Let's retrieve Jan 29 and Jan 30 etc.
